lesson1.when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the afternoon.
lesson1.example: こんにちは！お元気ですか？ (Konnichiwa! Ogenki desu ka?) - Hello! How are you?

lesson1.when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
lesson1.example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

lesson1.when_to_say: Used to say goodbye.
lesson1.example: さようなら！ (Sayounara!) - Goodbye!

lesson1.when_to_say: Used in the morning as a greeting.
lesson1.example: おはようございます！ (Ohayou gozaimasu!) - Good morning!

lesson1.word: ありがとうございまし
lesson1.when_to_say: Used to express deeper gratitude in formal settings.
lesson1.example: 本当にありがとうございます！ (Hontou ni arigatou gozaimasu!) - Thank you very much!

lesson1.when_to_say: Used to get someone's attention or apologize.
lesson1.example: すみません、ちょっと失礼します。 (Sumimasen, chotto shitsurei shimasu.) - Excuse me, I’m sorry.

lesson1.when_to_say: Used when asking for something politely.
lesson1.example: これをお願いします。 (Kore wo onegai shimasu.) - Please do this.

lesson1.when_to_say: Used to express affirmation.
lesson1.example: はい、わかりました。 (Hai, wakarimashita.) - Yes, I understand.

lesson1.when_to_say: Used to express negation.
lesson1.example: いいえ、違います。 (Iie, chigaimasu.) - No, that's not correct.

lesson1.when_to_say: Used to ask about someone's well-being.
lesson1.example: お元気ですか？ (Ogenki desu ka?) - How are you?

lesson1.when_to_say: Used to refer to the current time.
lesson1.example: 今、何時ですか？ (Ima, nanji desu ka?) - What time is it now?

lesson1.when_to_say: Used to refer to the following day.
lesson1.example: 明日会いましょう！ (Ashita aimashou!) - Let’s meet tomorrow!

lesson1.when_to_say: Used to refer to the day before today.
lesson1.example: 昨日何をしましたか？ (Kinou nani wo shimashita ka?) - What did you do yesterday?

lesson1.when_to_say: Used to make a polite request.
lesson1.example: これをお願いします。 (Kore wo onegai shimasu.) - Please do this.

lesson1.when_to_say: Used when offering something to someone.
lesson1.example: どうぞ、お先にどうぞ。 (Douzo, osaki ni douzo.) - Please, go ahead.

lesson1.meaning: good job / thank you for your hard work
lesson1.when_to_say: Used to acknowledge someone's effort or hard work.
lesson1.example: お疲れ様でした！ (Otsukaresama deshita!) - Good job!

lesson1.when_to_say: Used to say goodbye casually.
lesson1.example: じゃね、またね！ (Ja ne, mata ne!) - See you, later!

lesson1.when_to_say: Used to get someone’s attention or apologize.
lesson1.example: すみません、道を教えてください。 (Sumimasen, michi wo oshiete kudasai.) - Excuse me, could you tell me the way?

lesson1.when_to_say: Used casually for thanking or greeting.
lesson1.example: どうもありがとう！ (Doumo arigatou!) - Thanks a lot!

lesson1.word: よろしくお願いします
lesson1.meaning: nice to meet you / please take care of it
lesson1.when_to_say: Used to make a polite request or greet someone for the first time.
lesson1.example: よろしくお願いします！ (Yoroshiku onegaishimasu!) - Nice to meet you!

lesson2.when_to_say: Used when asking or referring to someone's name.
lesson2.example: あなたの名前は何ですか？ (Anata no namae wa nan desu ka?) - What is your name?

lesson2.when_to_say: Used when talking about someone's place of origin.
lesson2.example: あなたはどこから来ましたか？ (Anata wa doko kara kimashita ka?) - Where are you from?

lesson2.when_to_say: Used when asking or talking about someone's age.
lesson2.example: あなたの年齢は何ですか？ (Anata no nenrei wa nan desu ka?) - How old are you?

lesson2.when_to_say: Used to ask or talk about someone's job.
lesson2.example: あなたの職業は何ですか？ (Anata no shokugyou wa nan desu ka?) - What is your occupation?

lesson2.when_to_say: Used when talking about where someone lives.
lesson2.example: 私は東京に住んでいます。 (Watashi wa Tokyo ni sundeimasu.) - I live in Tokyo.

lesson2.when_to_say: Used when referring to school.
lesson2.example: 私は学校に通っています。 (Watashi wa gakkou ni kayotteimasu.) - I go to school.

lesson2.when_to_say: Used to express like or preference.
lesson2.example: 私は音楽が好きです。 (Watashi wa ongaku ga suki desu.) - I like music.

lesson2.when_to_say: Used when talking about family.
lesson2.example: 私の家族は四人です。 (Watashi no kazoku wa yonnin desu.) - My family has four people.

lesson2.when_to_say: Used when talking about friends.
lesson2.example: 彼は私の友達です。 (Kare wa watashi no tomodachi desu.) - He is my friend.

lesson2.when_to_say: Used when talking about Japan.
lesson2.example: 私は日本に行ったことがあります。 (Watashi wa Nihon ni itta koto ga arimasu.) - I have been to Japan.

lesson2.when_to_say: Used when talking about someone's hobby.
lesson2.example: 私の趣味は読書です。 (Watashi no shumi wa dokusho desu.) - My hobby is reading.

lesson2.when_to_say: Used to express strong affection for something.
lesson2.example: 私は映画が大好きです。 (Watashi wa eiga ga daisuki desu.) - I love movies.

lesson2.when_to_say: Used when talking about marriage.
lesson2.example: 彼は結婚しています。 (Kare wa kekkon shiteimasu.) - He is married.

lesson2.when_to_say: Used to refer to someone who is unmarried.
lesson2.example: 私は独身です。 (Watashi wa dokushin desu.) - I am single.

lesson2.when_to_say: Used when referring to brothers or siblings.
lesson2.example: 私は兄弟が三人います。 (Watashi wa kyoudai ga sannin imasu.) - I have three siblings.

lesson2.when_to_say: Used to refer to children.
lesson2.example: 私には二人の子供がいます。 (Watashi ni wa futari no kodomo ga imasu.) - I have two children.

lesson2.when_to_say: Used to refer to the following year.
lesson2.example: 来年日本に行きます。 (Rainen Nihon ni ikimasu.) - I am going to Japan next year.

lesson2.when_to_say: Used to refer to university or college.
lesson2.example: 私は大学に通っています。 (Watashi wa daigaku ni kayotteimasu.) - I attend university.

lesson2.when_to_say: Used to ask for or give someone's phone number.
lesson2.example: あなたの電話番号は何ですか？ (Anata no denwa bangou wa nan desu ka?) - What is your phone number?

lesson2.when_to_say: Used to refer to time.
lesson2.example: 今何時ですか？ (Ima nanji desu ka?) - What time is it now?

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to represent the number one.
lesson3.example: 私は一人です。 (Watashi wa hitori desu.) - I am alone.

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to represent the number two.
lesson3.example: 私は二つのリンゴを持っています。 (Watashi wa futatsu no ringo o motteimasu.) - I have two apples.

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to represent the number three.
lesson3.example: 三人の友達がいます。 (Sannin no tomodachi ga imasu.) - I have three friends.

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to represent the number four.
lesson3.example: 私は四つの本を持っています。 (Watashi wa yotsu no hon o motteimasu.) - I have four books.

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to represent the number five.
lesson3.example: 五つのオレンジがあります。 (Itsutsu no orenji ga arimasu.) - There are five oranges.

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to represent the number six.
lesson3.example: 六人の学生がいます。 (Roku-nin no gakusei ga imasu.) - There are six students.

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to represent the number seven.
lesson3.example: 七つの質問があります。 (Nanatsu no shitsumon ga arimasu.) - There are seven questions.

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to represent the number eight.
lesson3.example: 八人の先生がいます。 (Hachinin no sensei ga imasu.) - There are eight teachers.

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to represent the number nine.
lesson3.example: 九つの箱があります。 (Kokonotsu no hako ga arimasu.) - There are nine boxes.

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to represent the number ten.
lesson3.example: 十人の学生がいます。 (Juu-nin no gakusei ga imasu.) - There are ten students.

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to represent the number hundred.
lesson3.example: 百円のジュースを買いました。 (Hyaku en no juusu o kaimashita.) - I bought a 100-yen juice.

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to represent the number thousand.
lesson3.example: 千円の財布を持っています。 (Sen en no saifu o motteimasu.) - I have a 1000-yen wallet.

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to represent the number ten thousand.
lesson3.example: この本は万冊売れています。 (Kono hon wa man-satsu ureteimasu.) - This book has sold ten thousand copies.

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to refer to half of something.
lesson3.example: 今は三時半です。 (Ima wa sanji han desu.) - It is half-past three.

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to ask how many or what number.
lesson3.example: 何人ですか？ (Nannin desu ka?) - How many people?

lesson3.when_to_say: Used when referring to all things or people.
lesson3.example: 全部で十人です。 (Zenbu de juu-nin desu.) - There are ten people in total.

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to describe a small number or quantity.
lesson3.example: 学生は少ないです。 (Gakusei wa sukunai desu.) - There are few students.

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to describe a large number or quantity.
lesson3.example: 人が多いです。 (Hito ga ooi desu.) - There are many people.

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to refer to the next in sequence.
lesson3.example: 次は何ですか？ (Tsugi wa nan desu ka?) - What is next?

lesson3.when_to_say: Used to refer to the best or first in a series.
lesson3.example: 彼は一番早いです。 (Kare wa ichiban hayai desu.) - He is the fastest.

lesson4.when_to_say: Used when referring to the action of eating.
lesson4.example: 私はご飯を食べます。 (Watashi wa gohan o tabemasu.) - I eat rice.

lesson4.when_to_say: Used when referring to the action of drinking.
lesson4.example: 水を飲みます。 (Mizu o nomimasu.) - I drink water.

lesson4.when_to_say: Used to describe food that tastes good.
lesson4.example: このケーキはおいしいです。 (Kono kēki wa oishii desu.) - This cake is delicious.

lesson4.when_to_say: Refers to a meal or cooked rice in Japanese.
lesson4.example: ご飯を食べましたか？ (Gohan o tabemashita ka?) - Did you eat your meal?

lesson4.when_to_say: Refers to water in general.
lesson4.example: 水が飲みたいです。 (Mizu ga nomitai desu.) - I want to drink water.

lesson4.when_to_say: Used to refer to cooking or a type of cuisine.
lesson4.example: 日本料理が好きです。 (Nihon ryōri ga suki desu.) - I like Japanese cuisine.

lesson4.when_to_say: Refers to a place where meals are served.
lesson4.example: レストランに行きましょう。 (Resutoran ni ikimashou.) - Let's go to the restaurant.

lesson4.when_to_say: Used to refer to food in general.
lesson4.example: 食べ物を買いに行こう。 (Tabemono o kai ni ikou.) - Let's go buy food.

lesson4.when_to_say: Refers to the taste of food or drink.
lesson4.example: このスープは味がいいです。 (Kono sūpu wa aji ga ii desu.) - This soup tastes good.

lesson4.when_to_say: Used to describe food that is spicy.
lesson4.example: このカレーは辛いです。 (Kono karē wa karai desu.) - This curry is spicy.

lesson4.when_to_say: Used to describe something sweet, usually food.
lesson4.example: このケーキは甘いです。 (Kono kēki wa amai desu.) - This cake is sweet.

lesson4.when_to_say: Used to refer to beverages or drinks.
lesson4.example: 飲み物をください。 (Nomimono o kudasai.) - Please give me a drink.

lesson4.when_to_say: Refers to a salad, usually a side dish.
lesson4.example: サラダを注文します。 (Sarada o chūmon shimasu.) - I'll order a salad.

lesson4.when_to_say: Refers to tea, commonly served in Japan.
lesson4.example: お茶を飲みます。 (Ocha o nomimasu.) - I drink tea.

lesson4.when_to_say: Refers to the alcoholic beverage beer.
lesson4.example: ビールを飲みます。 (Bīru o nomimasu.) - I drink beer.

lesson4.when_to_say: Refers to sushi, a famous Japanese dish.
lesson4.example: 寿司を食べます。 (Sushi o tabemasu.) - I eat sushi.

lesson4.when_to_say: Refers to udon, a type of Japanese noodle.
lesson4.example: うどんが好きです。 (Udon ga suki desu.) - I like udon.

lesson4.when_to_say: Refers to ramen, a famous Japanese noodle dish.
lesson4.example: ラーメンが食べたいです。 (Rāmen ga tabetai desu.) - I want to eat ramen.

lesson4.when_to_say: Refers to takoyaki, a popular Japanese snack.
lesson4.example: たこ焼きを食べます。 (Takoyaki o tabemasu.) - I eat takoyaki.

lesson4.when_to_say: Refers to ice cream, a popular dessert.
lesson4.example: アイスクリームを食べます。 (Aisukurīmu o tabemasu.) - I eat ice cream.

lesson5.when_to_say: Used to indicate the right side or direction.
lesson5.example: 右に曲がってください。 (Migi ni magatte kudasai.) - Please turn right.

lesson5.when_to_say: Used to indicate the left side or direction.
lesson5.example: 左に行ってください。 (Hidari ni itte kudasai.) - Please go left.

lesson5.when_to_say: Used to indicate the front or forward direction.
lesson5.example: 前に進んでください。 (Mae ni susunde kudasai.) - Please move forward.

lesson5.when_to_say: Used to indicate the back or rear direction.
lesson5.example: 後ろに座ってください。 (Ushiro ni suwatte kudasai.) - Please sit in the back.

lesson5.when_to_say: Used to describe something that is near or close.
lesson5.example: 駅は近いです。 (Eki wa chikai desu.) - The station is near.

lesson5.when_to_say: Used to describe something that is far away.
lesson5.example: 学校は遠いです。 (Gakkō wa tōi desu.) - The school is far.

lesson5.when_to_say: Used to refer to a street corner or edge.
lesson5.example: 角を右に曲がってください。 (Kado o migi ni magatte kudasai.) - Please turn right at the corner.

lesson5.when_to_say: Used to refer to an intersection where streets meet.
lesson5.example: 交差点を渡ってください。 (Kōsaten o watatte kudasai.) - Please cross the intersection.

lesson5.when_to_say: Used to refer to a road or street.
lesson5.example: この道をまっすぐ行ってください。 (Kono michi o massugu itte kudasai.) - Please go straight down this road.

lesson5.when_to_say: Used to refer to a traffic light.
lesson5.example: 信号を待ってください。 (Shingō o matte kudasai.) - Please wait for the traffic light.

lesson5.when_to_say: Used to refer to a map for directions.
lesson5.example: 地図を見てください。 (Chizu o mite kudasai.) - Please look at the map.

lesson5.when_to_say: Used to indicate upward or above.
lesson5.example: 上を見てください。 (Ue o mite kudasai.) - Please look up.

lesson5.when_to_say: Used to indicate downward or below.
lesson5.example: 下を見てください。 (Shita o mite kudasai.) - Please look down.

lesson5.when_to_say: Used to refer to a street or avenue.
lesson5.example: この通りを歩いてください。 (Kono tōri o aruite kudasai.) - Please walk down this street.

lesson5.when_to_say: Used to refer to a road, usually a larger one.
lesson5.example: 道路を横断してください。 (Dōro o ōdan shite kudasai.) - Please cross the road.

lesson5.when_to_say: Refers to the right side of something.
lesson5.example: 右側に座ってください。 (Migigawa ni suwatte kudasai.) - Please sit on the right side.

lesson5.when_to_say: Refers to the left side of something.
lesson5.example: 左側に行ってください。 (Hidarigawa ni itte kudasai.) - Please go to the left side.

lesson5.when_to_say: Refers to the way or method of getting somewhere.
lesson5.example: 行き方を教えてください。 (Ikikata o oshiete kudasai.) - Please tell me the way.

lesson5.when_to_say: Used when referring to a detour or longer route.
lesson5.example: 遠回りをしないでください。 (Tōmawari o shinaide kudasai.) - Please don't take the detour.

lesson5.when_to_say: Used when referring to moving forward.
lesson5.example: 前に進んでください。 (Mae ni susunde kudasai.) - Please move forward.

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to a train, the most common form of public transportation in Japan.
lesson6.example: 電車で行きます。 (Densha de ikimasu.) - I will go by train.

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to a ticket for travel or admission.
lesson6.example: 切符を買ってください。 (Kippu o katte kudasai.) - Please buy a ticket.

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to a hotel for lodging.
lesson6.example: ホテルに泊まります。 (Hoteru ni tomarimasu.) - I will stay at the hotel.

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to an airport.
lesson6.example: 空港に着きました。 (Kūkō ni tsukimashita.) - I have arrived at the airport.

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to a bus, another common form of public transportation.
lesson6.example: バスに乗ります。 (Basu ni norimasu.) - I will take the bus.

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to a taxi.
lesson6.example: タクシーを呼んでください。 (Takushī o yonde kudasai.) - Please call a taxi.

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to an airplane.
lesson6.example: 飛行機で行きます。 (Hikōki de ikimasu.) - I will go by airplane.

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to luggage or bags.
lesson6.example: 荷物を預けてください。 (Nimotsu o azukete kudasai.) - Please check in your luggage.

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to a passport for international travel.
lesson6.example: パスポートを見せてください。 (Pasupōto o misete kudasai.) - Please show your passport.

lesson6.when_to_say: Used when changing from one mode of transportation to another.
lesson6.example: 駅で乗り換えがあります。 (Eki de norikae ga arimasu.) - There is a transfer at the station.

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to an exit or way out.
lesson6.example: 出口はどこですか？ (Deguchi wa doko desu ka?) - Where is the exit?

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to immigration at the border.
lesson6.example: 入国審査を受けます。 (Nyūkoku shinsa o ukemasu.) - I will go through immigration inspection.

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to exiting a country, usually at the airport.
lesson6.example: 出国手続きはここです。 (Shukkoku tetsuzuki wa koko desu.) - The exit procedures are here.

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to a reservation for a hotel, flight, or restaurant.
lesson6.example: ホテルの予約をしています。 (Hoteru no yoyaku o shiteimasu.) - I have a reservation at the hotel.

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to sightseeing or touring.
lesson6.example: 観光地を訪れます。 (Kankōchi o otozuremasu.) - I will visit sightseeing spots.

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to a map for navigation.
lesson6.example: 地図を持っていますか？ (Chizu o motteimasu ka?) - Do you have a map?

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to currency exchange.
lesson6.example: 両替所はどこですか？ (Ryōgaesho wa doko desu ka?) - Where is the currency exchange office?

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to a gift or souvenir typically brought back from a trip.
lesson6.example: お土産を買いました。 (Omiyage o kaimashita.) - I bought souvenirs.

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to the act of returning to one’s home country.
lesson6.example: 来週、帰国します。 (Raishū, kikoku shimasu.) - I will return to my country next week.

lesson6.when_to_say: Used to refer to a traditional Japanese inn, often with tatami floors and futons.
lesson6.example: 旅館に泊まりました。 (Ryokan ni tomarimashita.) - I stayed at a ryokan.

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to refer to time, the concept of hours, or the duration of an event.
lesson7.example: 今、時間ですか？ (Ima, jikan desu ka?) - What time is it now?

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to refer to the current day.
lesson7.example: 今日は忙しいです。 (Kyou wa isogashii desu.) - I am busy today.

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to refer to the day after today.
lesson7.example: 明日は休みです。 (Ashita wa yasumi desu.) - Tomorrow is a holiday.

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to refer to the day before today.
lesson7.example: 昨日は忙しかったです。 (Kinou wa isogashikatta desu.) - Yesterday was busy.

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to refer to the weekend, typically Saturday and Sunday.
lesson7.example: 週末に旅行します。 (Shuumatsu ni ryokou shimasu.) - I will travel on the weekend.

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to refer to Monday, the first day of the week.
lesson7.example: 月曜日に会いましょう。 (Getsuyoubi ni aimashou.) - Let's meet on Monday.

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to refer to Tuesday, the second day of the week.
lesson7.example: 火曜日は空いています。 (Kayoubi wa aiteimasu.) - I am free on Tuesday.

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to refer to Wednesday, the third day of the week.
lesson7.example: 水曜日は忙しいです。 (Suiyoubi wa isogashii desu.) - I am busy on Wednesday.

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to refer to Thursday, the fourth day of the week.
lesson7.example: 木曜日に会いましょう。 (Mokuyoubi ni aimashou.) - Let's meet on Thursday.

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to refer to Friday, the fifth day of the week.
lesson7.example: 金曜日にパーティーがあります。 (Kinyoubi ni paatii ga arimasu.) - There is a party on Friday.

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to refer to Saturday, the sixth day of the week.
lesson7.example: 土曜日に買い物に行きます。 (Doyoubi ni kaimono ni ikimasu.) - I will go shopping on Saturday.

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to refer to Sunday, the seventh day of the week.
lesson7.example: 日曜日に休みます。 (Nichiyoubi ni yasumimasu.) - I will rest on Sunday.

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to refer to the morning or AM time.
lesson7.example: 午前9時に会いましょう。 (Gozen ku-ji ni aimashou.) - Let's meet at 9 AM.

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to refer to the afternoon or PM time.
lesson7.example: 午後3時に会いましょう。 (Gogo san-ji ni aimashou.) - Let's meet at 3 PM.

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to refer to a year.
lesson7.example: 今年は忙しい年です。 (Kotoshi wa isogashii toshi desu.) - This year is a busy year.

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to refer to a month.
lesson7.example: 来月は忙しいです。 (Raigetsu wa isogashii desu.) - Next month will be busy.

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to refer to a day or date.
lesson7.example: 今日は何日ですか？ (Kyou wa nannichi desu ka?) - What is today's date?

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to refer to a week.
lesson7.example: 今週は忙しいです。 (Konshuu wa isogashii desu.) - This week is busy.

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to describe something that lasts a long time.
lesson7.example: 長い時間待ちました。 (Nagai jikan machimashita.) - I waited for a long time.

lesson7.when_to_say: Used to describe something that lasts a short time.
lesson7.example: 短い休憩を取りました。 (Mijikai kyuukei wo torimashita.) - I took a short break.

lesson8.when_to_say: Used when purchasing something.
lesson8.example: 何を買いますか？ (Nani o kaimasu ka?) - What will you buy?

lesson8.when_to_say: Used to refer to a shop or store.
lesson8.example: 近くに店がありますか？ (Chikaku ni mise ga arimasu ka?) - Is there a store nearby?

lesson8.when_to_say: Used to ask about the cost of something.
lesson8.example: 値段はいくらですか？ (Nedan wa ikura desu ka?) - How much does it cost?

lesson8.when_to_say: Used to describe something inexpensive.
lesson8.example: この商品は安いです。 (Kono shouhin wa yasui desu.) - This product is cheap.

lesson8.when_to_say: Used to describe something costly.
lesson8.example: このバッグは高いです。 (Kono baggu wa takai desu.) - This bag is expensive.

lesson8.when_to_say: Used to talk about paying by credit card.
lesson8.example: クレジットカードで払えますか？ (Kurejitto kaado de haraemasu ka?) - Can I pay by credit card?

lesson8.when_to_say: Used when referring to physical money.
lesson8.example: 現金で払います。 (Genkin de haraimasu.) - I will pay in cash.

lesson8.when_to_say: Used when talking about shopping in general.
lesson8.example: 買い物に行きます。 (Kaimono ni ikimasu.) - I am going shopping.

lesson8.when_to_say: Used to refer to discounted items.
lesson8.example: セール商品を見たいです。 (Seeru shouhin o mitai desu.) - I want to see sale items.

lesson8.when_to_say: Used to refer to items for sale.
lesson8.example: 新しい商品がありますか？ (Atarashii shouhin ga arimasu ka?) - Do you have new products?

lesson8.when_to_say: Used when trying on clothes in a shop.
lesson8.example: 試着できますか？ (Shichaku dekimasu ka?) - Can I try this on?

lesson8.when_to_say: Used when asking for or referring to a receipt.
lesson8.example: レシートをください。 (Reshiito o kudasai.) - Please give me the receipt.

lesson8.when_to_say: Used to ask for or mention a discount.
lesson8.example: 割引はありますか？ (Waribiki wa arimasu ka?) - Is there a discount?

lesson8.when_to_say: Used to ask about the size of an item.
lesson8.example: このサイズはありますか？ (Kono saizu wa arimasu ka?) - Do you have this size?

lesson8.when_to_say: Used when returning a purchased item.
lesson8.example: 返品できますか？ (Henpin dekimasu ka?) - Can I return this?

lesson8.when_to_say: Used to ask about or mention loyalty cards.
lesson8.example: ポイントカードは使えますか？ (Pointo kaado wa tsukaemasu ka?) - Can I use my point card?

lesson8.when_to_say: Used to describe the location of items in a store.
lesson8.example: この棚には何がありますか？ (Kono tana ni wa nani ga arimasu ka?) - What is on this shelf?

lesson8.when_to_say: Used to refer to change given after a payment.
lesson8.example: おつりを忘れないでください。 (Otsuri o wasurenaide kudasai.) - Please don’t forget your change.

lesson8.when_to_say: Used to refer to the checkout area.
lesson8.example: レジはどこですか？ (Reji wa doko desu ka?) - Where is the cash register?

lesson8.when_to_say: Used to ask for gift wrapping or packaging.
lesson8.example: 包装してください。 (Housou shite kudasai.) - Please wrap this.

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to talk about one's occupation or tasks.
lesson9.example: 仕事はどうですか？ (Shigoto wa dou desu ka?) - How is your job?

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to refer to business meetings.
lesson9.example: 会議は何時ですか？ (Kaigi wa nanji desu ka?) - What time is the meeting?

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to refer to people you work with.
lesson9.example: 同僚と一緒に昼食を食べます。 (Douryou to issho ni chuushoku o tabemasu.) - I eat lunch with my colleagues.

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to refer to one's superior at work.
lesson9.example: 上司に報告します。 (Joushi ni houkoku shimasu.) - I will report to my boss.

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to refer to someone working under you.
lesson9.example: 部下に指示を出します。 (Buka ni shiji o dashimasu.) - I will give instructions to my subordinates.

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to refer to paperwork or official documents.
lesson9.example: 書類を確認してください。 (Shorui o kakunin shite kudasai.) - Please check the documents.

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to refer to due dates for tasks or projects.
lesson9.example: 締め切りはいつですか？ (Shimekiri wa itsu desu ka?) - When is the deadline?

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to talk about taking a short break.
lesson9.example: 少し休憩しましょう。 (Sukoshi kyuukei shimashou.) - Let’s take a short break.

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to refer to electronic mail.
lesson9.example: メールを送りましたか？ (Meeru o okurimashita ka?) - Did you send the email?

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to talk about discussions or chats.
lesson9.example: 会話を記録します。 (Kaiwa o kiroku shimasu.) - I will record the conversation.

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to refer to a specific task or work initiative.
lesson9.example: 新しいプロジェクトを始めます。 (Atarashii purojekuto o hajimemasu.) - I am starting a new project.

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to refer to scheduled meetings or visits.
lesson9.example: アポイントを取ります。 (Apointo o torimasu.) - I will make an appointment.

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to talk about a planned agenda.
lesson9.example: 日程を調整します。 (Nittei o chousei shimasu.) - I will adjust the schedule.

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to refer to keeping in touch with someone.
lesson9.example: 後で連絡します。 (Ato de renraku shimasu.) - I will contact you later.

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to refer to documents for a task.
lesson9.example: 資料を準備してください。 (Shiryou o junbi shite kudasai.) - Please prepare the materials.

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to refer to the front desk or reception area.
lesson9.example: 受付で名前を伝えます。 (Uketsuke de namae o tsutaemasu.) - I will give my name at the reception.

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to refer to specific divisions in a company.
lesson9.example: 私の部署は営業部です。 (Watashi no busho wa eigyoubu desu.) - My department is the sales department.

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to refer to giving updates on a task.
lesson9.example: 進捗を報告します。 (Shinchoku o houkoku shimasu.) - I will report on the progress.

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to refer to financial tasks or departments.
lesson9.example: 会計はどこですか？ (Kaikei wa doko desu ka?) - Where is accounting?

lesson9.when_to_say: Used to refer to handing in documents or tasks.
lesson9.example: レポートを提出します。 (Repooto o teishutsu shimasu.) - I will submit the report.

lesson10.when_to_say: Used to call for help in emergencies.
lesson10.example: 助けてください！ (Tasukete kudasai!) - Please help me!

lesson10.when_to_say: Used to call for medical assistance.
lesson10.example: 救急車を呼んでください。 (Kyuukyuu-sha o yonde kudasai.) - Please call an ambulance.

lesson10.when_to_say: Used to warn of danger or risky situations.
lesson10.example: 危ない！気をつけて！ (Abunai! Ki o tsukete!) - Danger! Be careful!

lesson10.when_to_say: Used to describe a fire emergency.
lesson10.example: 火事だ！ (Kaji da!) - There's a fire!

lesson10.when_to_say: Used to refer to law enforcement in emergencies.
lesson10.example: 警察を呼んでください。 (Keisatsu o yonde kudasai.) - Please call the police.

lesson10.when_to_say: Used during natural disaster situations.
lesson10.example: 地震です！気をつけて！ (Jishin desu! Ki o tsukete!) - It’s an earthquake! Be careful!

lesson10.when_to_say: Used to describe rescue operations or assistance.
lesson10.example: 救助を待っています。 (Kyuujo o matteimasu.) - I am waiting for rescue.

lesson10.when_to_say: Used when seeking medical care.
lesson10.example: 病院はどこですか？ (Byouin wa doko desu ka?) - Where is the hospital?

lesson10.when_to_say: Used when you are lost and need directions.
lesson10.example: 道に迷いました。助けてください。 (Michi ni mayoimashita. Tasukete kudasai.) - I’m lost. Please help.

lesson10.when_to_say: Used when talking about or requesting medicine.
lesson10.example: 薬が必要です。 (Kusuri ga hitsuyou desu.) - I need medicine.

lesson10.when_to_say: Used to describe a child who is lost.
lesson10.example: 迷子を探しています。 (Maigo o sagashiteimasu.) - I’m looking for a lost child.

lesson10.when_to_say: Used during emergencies requiring evacuation.
lesson10.example: 避難場所はどこですか？ (Hinan basho wa doko desu ka?) - Where is the evacuation area?

lesson10.when_to_say: Used to tell someone to escape or run away.
lesson10.example: 危ない！逃げて！ (Abunai! Nigete!) - Danger! Run away!

lesson10.when_to_say: Used to refer to someone who is injured.
lesson10.example: 負傷者を助けてください。 (Fushousha o tasukete kudasai.) - Please help the injured.

lesson10.when_to_say: Used to describe urgent situations.
lesson10.example: 緊急事態です！ (Kinkyuu jitai desu!) - It’s an emergency!

lesson10.when_to_say: Used to refer to hazardous conditions.
lesson10.example: ここは危険です。 (Koko wa kiken desu.) - This place is dangerous.

lesson10.when_to_say: Used when seeking to use a phone.
lesson10.example: 電話を貸してください。 (Denwa o kashite kudasai.) - Please lend me a phone.

lesson10.when_to_say: Used to refer to emergency medical care.
lesson10.example: 応急処置が必要です。 (Oukyuu shochi ga hitsuyou desu.) - First aid is needed.

lesson10.when_to_say: Used to describe reporting emergencies to authorities.
lesson10.example: 事件を通報します。 (Jiken o tsuuhou shimasu.) - I will report the incident.

lesson10.when_to_say: Used to refer to places for safety in emergencies.
lesson10.example: 避難所に向かっています。 (Hinanjo ni mukatteimasu.) - I’m heading to the shelter.
